reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights, and we usually come down twice a year its a great hotel with a very caring owner tom who creates a very nice homely atomsphere, rooms are well decorated and clean, the breakfast was superb
reviews.title: Fantastic its open again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We could not believe our luck when this hotel had a vacancy. We were met by a very friendly owner who welcomed us and showed us our room. The room was clean and looked newly decorated. The bed was glorious and was dressed in beautiful cotton bedding. After a great nights sleep the breakfast was plentiful and the dinning room bright and friendly.
reviews.title: What a great place to find.

reviews.text: A great stay all round and I will certainly go back.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Bowling Green Hotel (for the 1st time) for 3 nights whilst visiting family in Plymouth. We had walked past it on a previous visit and decided to take a look at the website and also read reviews on Trip Advisor. It looked very nice on the website and the tariff was reasonable, also there was the added bonus of a garage included in the price so we booked 2 rooms.
reviews.title: An enjoyable stay and excellent accommodation !

reviews.text: The rooms were both lovely, very comfortable and very clean. The hospitality tray was also very good with good quality beverages, biscuits and even a jug of fresh milk instead of the little cartons of UHT milk which I thought was a nice touch. The only criticism - and it is very minor is that the water from the shower in our room was only warm, not hot as I like it but the shower in the other room was fine. Both rooms were at the front of the hotel overlooking the bowling green which was a lovely outlook.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable and Still Open for Business!

reviews.text: Friends in Plymouth recommended we stay here whilst visiting them in September. What a wonderful place. Exceptionally clean, very friendly, quiet stay, just the best bed & breakfast ever. The owner, Tom, was a gem, and we thoroughly enjoyed talking to him after breakfast. They provide a full English breakfast, which looked exceptional, but friends kept us eating and drinking so that we weren't hungry for breakfast. I can say that the coffee was the best I've ever had - even better than Starbucks or Cafe Nero. The location was excellent, the hospitality exceptional, and the stay was perfect. i cannot recommend this enough, I loved it!
reviews.title: The BEST

reviews.text: We had a lovely stay at the Bowling Green Hotel. Lovely clean rooms, great breakfast and very good service from the staff and owner. Would definetely reccomend a stay if you are visiting Plymouth
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.text: Excellent service and a very friendly welcome from Tom. Beautifully appointed rooms throughout hotel. Spacious bedroom with very comfortable beds, and nice touches - hot chocolate as well as tea and coffee; shower gel and shampoo in bathroom. Delicious breakfast menu, with a choice of more than just "a full English" with again nice touches- seeds and raisins to add to variety of fruit, as well as a choice of yoghurts, cereals and croissants. Lovely conservatory off breakfast room. Excellent position on The Hoe and easy walk to the city centre and all attractions - Smeaton's tower, the Barbican and the sea. Lots of interest to see and do in Plymouth - we wished we had had more time.
reviews.title: THE place to stay in Plymouth

reviews.text: Only stayed one night en route to Cornwall but wouls loved to have stayed longer. Superb location close to Plymouth Hoe and plentiful attractions and also close to city centre if required. Owner very friendly and helpful, rooms impeccably clean and breakfast very good.
reviews.title: Excellent value & location and friendly service
Five Star Accommodation
reviews.text: Nothing bad to say, this place is five star, very clean, very friendly, breakfast was excellant and Tom the owner couldn't have been more helpful. We will definitely stay again.
We found the Hotel to be exceptionally clean & comfortable
reviews.title: Definilely a Hotel to revisit

reviews.text: The Management & Staff to be most helpful & obliging & we
reviews.title: Comfortable, Central and Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: have no hestitation in visiting The Hotel again.
reviews.title: Lovely Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Plymouth to collect our son returning from overseas. We needed to be in town from Friday to Monday. The Bowling Green Hotel offered value for money accommodation which was comfortable and clean with a good breakfast. The hotel overlooks the Hoe and a short walk leads to fantastic views over Plymouth Sound.
reviews.title: Brilliant, must do

reviews.text: A nicely presented hotel which offered lovely views across Plymouth Hoe, and only a short walk away from the Barbican, with an excellent choice of restaurants. The room was well-presented & very welcoming with tea, coffee & even a couple of chocolate biscuits! I would advise that if you have a particularly large car, (or you are not that great at reversing) not to take up the "secure parking" option, as access to the garages at the rear of the hotel is, shall we say, "challenging". The bed was very comfortable. We chose to have only cereal for breakfast, so cannot comment on the quality of the full English breakfast, but we were able to choose from a variety of cereals, yoghurts & fruit. We were made to feel very welcome & would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Surprised at all the positive reviews on here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have had the privilege of staying at this 'Hotel' on several occasions and have found that the HIGH STANDARDS of cleanliness, facilities and comfort, which are very important to us, are faithfully maintained on each occasion.
reviews.title: Found the 'Treasure' - No need to search anywhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 'service' fronted by 'Tom', the owner, is very friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Super stay would totally recommend

reviews.text: 'Breakfast' is superb - a selection, I would have thought, would suit most individual requirements.
reviews.title: I would recommend the hotel to anyone!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Obviously, our next visit to the Plymouth area will include a 'booking' at this Hotel!
reviews.title: We have no hesitation in returning for next visit to Plymouth,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
